New Records: Virat Kohli made a record 50th one-day international century
Mohammed Shami grabbed seven wickets, the best figures in a World Cup semi-final
Shami is now the leading wicket-taker in the tournament with 23 wickets
Shami's 7 for 57 is the 14th-best set of figures in a men's ODI
This match had the highest aggregate in a men's World Cup knockout game with 663 runs
Key Match Events: Virat Kohli scored his 50th ODI century
Mohammed Shami took 7 wickets for 57 runs
Daryl Mitchell scored 134 for New Zealand
India reached the World Cup final
Key wickets included Williamson, Mitchell, and Latham
Pre-Game Insights: India won the toss and chose to bat
India were considered favorites given their performance in the tournament
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma expressed pride in the team's performance despite some pressure moments
Kane Williamson praised India's performance and acknowledged the tough conditions
Rohit Sharma commented on the team's calmness under pressure and highlighted Shami's brilliance
Mohammed Shami gave a cheerful interview, emphasizing simplicity in his approach
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played under challenging conditions with the ball swinging a lot initially
The crowd's reaction fluctuated with the game's high-pressure moments
India's performance in the tournament included winning five games chasing and five games batting first
